Package net.lymarket.lyapi.spigot.utils.effect

Class EffectDisplay

java.lang.Object
net.lymarket.lyapi.spigot.utils.effect.EffectDisplay
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class EffectDisplay extends Object implements Cloneable
By default the particle xyz offsets and speed aren't 0, but everything will be 0 by default in this class. Particles are spawned to a location. So all the nearby players can see it.

The fields of this class are publicly accessible for ease of use. All the fields can be null except the particle type.

For cross-version compatibility, instead of Bukkit's Color the java awt Color class is used.

the data field is used to store special particle data, such as colored particles. For colored particles a float list is used since the particle size is a float. The format of float list data for a colored particle is: [r, g, b, size]

Version:
7.1.0
Author:
Crypto Morin
See Also:
  • XEffect

  • Method Details

    • colored

      public static EffectDisplay colored(org.bukkit.Location location, int r, int g, int b, float size)
      Builds a simple EffectDisplay object with cross-version compatible properties. Only REDSTONE particle type can be colored like this.
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the display.
      size - the size of the dust.
      Returns:
      a redstone colored dust.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • simple(Location, ParticleEffect)

    • colored

      public static EffectDisplay colored(org.bukkit.Location location, Color color, float size)
      Builds a simple EffectDisplay object with cross-version compatible properties. Only REDSTONE particle type can be colored like this.
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the display.
      color - the color of the particle.
      size - the size of the dust.
      Returns:
      a redstone colored dust.
      Since:
      3.0.0
      See Also:

    • simple

      public static EffectDisplay simple(org.bukkit.Location location, xyz.xenondevs.particle.ParticleEffect particle)
      Builds a simple EffectDisplay object. An invocation of this method yields exactly the same result as the expression:

      new EffectDisplay(particle, location, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0);
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the display.
      particle - the particle of the display.
      Returns:
      a simple EffectDisplay with count 1 and no offset, rotation etc.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • of

      public static EffectDisplay of(xyz.xenondevs.particle.ParticleEffect particle)
      Since:
      6.0.0.1

    • display

      public static EffectDisplay display(org.bukkit.Location location, xyz.xenondevs.particle.ParticleEffect particle)
      A quick access method to display a simple particle. An invocation of this method yields the same result as the expression:

      EffectDisplay.simple(location, particle).spawn();
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the particle.
      particle - the particle to show.
      Returns:
      a simple EffectDisplay with count 1 and no offset, rotation etc.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • fromConfig

      public static EffectDisplay fromConfig(org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection config)
      Builds particle settings from a configuration section.
      Parameters:
      config - the config section for the settings.
      Returns:
      a parsed EffectDisplay from the config.
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • edit

      public static EffectDisplay edit(EffectDisplay display, org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection config)
      Builds particle settings from a configuration section. Keys in config can be :
      • particle : the particle type.
      • count : the count as integer, at least 0.
      • extra : the particle speed, most of the time.
      • force : true or false, if the particle has force or not.
      • offset : the offset where values are separated by commas "dx, dy, dz".
      • rotation : the rotation of the particles in degrees.
      • color : the data representing color "R, G, B, size" where RGB values are integers between 0 and 255 and size is a positive (or null) float.
      • blockdata : the data representing block data. Given by a material name that's a block.
      • materialdata : same than blockdata, but with legacy data before 1.12. Do not use this in 1.13 and above.
      • itemstack : the data representing item. Given by a material name that's an item.
      Parameters:
      display - the particle display settings to update.
      config - the config section for the settings.
      Returns:
      the same EffectDisplay, but edited.
      Since:
      5.0.0

    • rotateAround

      public static org.bukkit.util.Vector rotateAround(org.bukkit.util.Vector location, EffectDisplay.Axis axis, org.bukkit.util.Vector rotation)
      Rotates the given location vector around a certain axis.
      Parameters:
      location - the location to rotate.
      axis - the axis to rotate the location around.
      rotation - the rotation vector that contains the degrees of the rotation. The number is taken from this vector according to the given axis.
      Since:
      7.0.0

    • onSpawn

      public EffectDisplay onSpawn(Predicate<org.bukkit.Location> onSpawn)
      A simple event that is called after the final calculations of each particle location are applied. You can modify the given location. It's NOT a copy.
      Parameters:
      onSpawn - a predicate that if returns false, it'll not spawn that particle.
      Returns:
      the same particle display.
      Since:
      7.0.0

    • forceSpawn

      public EffectDisplay forceSpawn(boolean force)
      A displayed particle with force can be seen further away for all player regardless of their particle settings. Force has no effect if specific players are added with spawn(Location, Player...).
      Parameters:
      force - the force argument.
      Returns:
      the same particle display, but modified.
      Since:
      5.0.1

    • withColor

      public EffectDisplay withColor(Color color, float size)
      Adds color properties to the particle settings. The particle must be ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP to get custom colors.
      Parameters:
      color - the RGB color of the particle.
      size - the size of the particle.
      Returns:
      the same particle display, but modified.
      Since:
      3.0.0
      See Also:

    • withBlock

      public EffectDisplay withBlock(org.bukkit.material.MaterialData materialData)
      Adds data for ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP, ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP and ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP particles if the minecraft version is 1.13 or more.

      If version is at most 1.12, old particles ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP, ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP and ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP will support this data.

      Parameters:
      materialData - the material data that will change the particle data.
      Returns:
      the same particle display, but modified.
      Since:
      5.1.0

    • withItem

      public EffectDisplay withItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Adds extra data for ParticleEffect.WATER_DROP particle, depending on the given item stack.
      Parameters:
      item - the item stack that will change the particle data.
      Returns:
      the same particle display, but modified.
      Since:
      5.1.0

    • rotationOrder

      public EffectDisplay rotationOrder(EffectDisplay.Axis first, EffectDisplay.Axis second, EffectDisplay.Axis third)
      Sets the rotation order that the particles should be rotated. Yes,it matters which axis you rotate first as it'll have an impact on the other rotations.
      Since:
      7.0.0

    • rotate

      public EffectDisplay rotate(double x, double y, double z)
      Rotates the particle position based on the xyz radians. Rotations are only supported for some shapes in XEffect. Rotating some of them can result in weird shapes.
      Since:
      3.0.0
      See Also:

    • directional

      public EffectDisplay directional()
      When a particle is set to be directional it'll only spawn one particle and the xyz offset values are used for the direction of the particle.

      Colored particles in 1.12 and below don't support this.

      Returns:
      the same particle display.
      Since:
      1.1.0
      See Also:
      • isDirectional()

    • isDirectional

      public boolean isDirectional()
      Check if this particle setting is a directional particle.
      Returns:
      true if the particle is directional, otherwise false.
      Since:
      2.1.0
      See Also:
      • directional()

    • spawn

      public org.bukkit.Location spawn(org.bukkit.Location loc)

      Since:
      2.1.0

    • spawn

      public org.bukkit.Location spawn(org.bukkit.Location loc, org.bukkit.entity.Player... players)
      Displays the particle in the specified location. This method does not support rotations if used directly.
      Parameters:
      loc - the location to display the particle at.
      players - if this particle should only be sent to specific players. Shouldn't be empty.
      Since:
      5.0.0
      See Also:
